importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date Kada Scott was reported missing and the black Hyundai Accent was reported stolen, which is tied to evidence linking Keon King to her disappearance.
The date when investigators returned to the abandoned school after a new tip, leading to the discovery of Scott's remains.
The date of the news update and official announcement of the discovery and charges related to Kada Scott's case.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe during which the stolen vehicle was seen and when Scott disappeared, establishing a timeline connecting King’s actions to her disappearance.
The period between Scott’s disappearance and the discovery of her remains, during which multiple investigative actions occurred, including re-searching the site.

keyTakeAways: Kada Scott's remains were found behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia after an anonymous tip led investigators to re-examine the area.

Keon King, 21, of Dover, Delaware, was arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, causing or risking a catastrophe, and possible homicide after DNA tests confirmed his connection to Scott’s remains.

The black Hyundai Accent, reported stolen on October 4, was seen parked near Scott’s disappearance site and later found on fire; the vehicle was destroyed at a junkyard, limiting forensic examination.
A new tip prompting investigators to return to the school site after a previous failed search led to the discovery of Scott's body in a shallow grave.
Prosecutors believe additional individuals may have been involved in the case, and investigations into post-facto involvement are ongoing.
King was previously arrested in another kidnapping case, but charges were dropped due to lack of appearance by the victim and witness.
Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman who worked in an assisted living facility, was remembered by her parents as a source of kindness and light, and her family expressed deep grief over her disappearance.

namedEntities.name: Kada Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A missing 23-year-old woman who worked in an assisted living facility; her remains were found behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is the central figure whose disappearance and subsequent discovery drive the entire narrative of the article.

namedEntities.name: Keon King
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and possible homicide related to Kada Scott’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the primary suspect directly linked to the case through cell phone data, vehicle evidence, and DNA confirmation.

namedEntities.name: District Attorney Larry Krasner
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The lead prosecutor in the case, responsible for filing charges and publicly stating that homicide charges are under consideration.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He provides official legal direction and sets the tone for the investigation and prosecution process.

namedEntities.name: Ashley Toczylowski
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A prosecutor who presented evidence linking King to Scott’s disappearance, including video footage and cell phone location data.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is a key figure in presenting the evidentiary basis for the charges and explaining the investigative process.

namedEntities.name: Black Hyundai Accent
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A stolen vehicle reported on October 4, seen parked near Scott’s disappearance site, later found on fire and destroyed.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It serves as a physical link between King and the timeline of Scott’s disappearance.

namedEntities.name: Abandoned school
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A location behind which the remains of Kada Scott were discovered in a shallow grave.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is the specific site where Scott’s remains were found, making it a critical geographical and investigative location.

namedEntities.name: Dover, Delaware
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The hometown of Keon King, where he was arrested and later released on bond in a prior case.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It establishes King’s connection to a different location and provides context for his prior legal history.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The city where Kada Scott was reported missing and where the crime scene and arrests took place.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is the primary jurisdiction involved in the investigation and legal proceedings.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The remains of Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman reported missing in Philadelphia, were discovered in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school after a new tip led investigators to re-examine the site. Keon King, a 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and possibly homicide. DNA tests confirmed Scott’s identity, and evidence such as cell phone locations and a stolen black Hyundai Accent seen near the scene link King to her disappearance. Authorities believe others may have been involved, and investigations are ongoing. King previously faced charges in another case that were dropped due to lack of witness appearance. Scott’s parents described her as a source of kindness and light, and the case has drawn significant public attention.
title: Remains found behind abandoned school belong to missing Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, officials say
